member.name: M:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDElement.HasProblems(Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDElement.Format)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the has detected any problems with its values.
member.param: The mode to run the checks in. See for details.
member.returns: A value indicating whether problems were detected.

remarks.para: Details of any problems detected may be obtained by calling .
remarks.note: Note to implementors: if the subclass is capable of detecting problems with the values input by the user - for example, violations of the LDraw specification, or combinations of settings which are mutually exclusive - it should override both this and . The value returned should be OR'd with the value returned by the superclass.

member.name: M:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDElement.Analyse(Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDElement.Format)
member.summary: Checks the for problems.
member.param: The mode to run the checks in.
member.returns: A collection of s describing any problems detected with the .

remarks.para:
The values for are heirarchical: is a superset of , which is a superset of . is thus the most lax and the most strict. In general, the following will be reported for each mode:
Anything that contravenes the LDraw.org File Format specification. Deprecated syntax will be reported as s, all others as s.
As for , plus anything that contravenes the LDraw.org File Format Restrictions for the Official Library. Deprecated syntax will be reported as s, all others as s. Some issues reported as s when in mode may have their severity increased to .
As for , plus anything that contravenes the Official Model Repository (OMR) Specification. Deprecated syntax will be reported as s, all others as s. Some issues reported as s when in or mode may have their severity increased to .

This method may be expensive to call, depending on what processing the has to carry out to build the collection. To find out whether there are any problems without incurring the possible overheads of Analyse(), see .
remarks.note: Note to implementors: if the subclass is capable of detecting problems with the values input by the user - for example, violations of the LDraw specification, or combinations of settings which are mutually exclusive - it should override both this and . For each problem detected, an should be added to the collection returned by the superclass.

member.summary: Occurs when the changes in some way.

remarks.para: Whenever a property-specific or action-specific event is published by the , this event will also be sent, with its property set to the name of the specific event that occurred. This event may thus be subscribed to as an alternative to subscribing individually to each of the specific events.

The event is also propagated up to the 's , which will pass it on through . This allows a subscriber to receive notification of changes to any descendant of an without having to subscribe to each element individually.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDElement.IsLocked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the may be modified.
member.exception: The operation is set and the is frozen.

remarks.para: An may be locked explicitly by setting the value of this property to true; or implicitly by locking or freezing one of its ancestors in the document-tree. In either case, if this property returns true attempting to modify the either directly or indirectly via its methods and properties will cause an to be thrown.

If the is simply locked, either explicitly or implicitly, it is always possible to change the value of this property. If the is frozen as well, either expliclity or implicitly, the value of this property may not be changed.
Raises the event when its value changes.
Default value is false.
remarks.note: Note to implementors: this must be supported by all subclasses. Each property or method which modifies the must check the value of IsLocked before proceeding, and throw an if it is true.

member.summary: Sets from the supplied LDraw code.

The ColourValue of an is one of:
The of an from the system palette
The of an which precedes the in the document-tree
A Direct Colours value

example.code: SetColourValue("1"); // set ColourValue to a Code, from either the system-palette or an LDrawColour in the document-tree SetColourValue("#2FF0000"); // set ColourValue to an opaque Direct Colours value of fully-saturated red SetColourValue("0x2FF0000"); // the same as above but with the '0x' prefix SetColourValue("50266112"); // the same as above but in base-10

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.Library.LibraryManager
member.summary: Represents the LDraw library installed on this computer.

remarks.para: LibraryManager provides two functions: an event which reports when items are added to or removed from the installed library, or are modified or renamed; and a cache to speed up access to the items in the library.
On startup, LibraryManager installs a to monitor for changes to any component of the . It detects files and folders being added, removed, modified or renamed and raises the event when this occurs.

The cache indexes the contents of the installed library and returns a collection of s. The cache may be initalised by calling , and if successful is made available via . When occurs, the cache will update itself. This cache is also written automatically to global Isolated Storage to speed up indexing the next time it is loaded.
If the cache is loaded, will make use of it when resolving its . The cache also provides the of the LDraw library, and lists of the categories found in it.

Finally, whilst the DOM itself does not use the parts.lst file, older LDraw programs may still rely on it. LibraryManager provides APIs to write this file from the cached data, and can optionally update it automatically when the cache updates.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDMetaCommand
member.summary: Represents an LDraw meta-command as defined in the LDraw.org File Format specification.

remarks.para: This is the base-class for all meta-commands which do not generate graphical elements (for these, see ) and which do not appear in the header section of an LDraw file (for these, see the properties of ).

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourOpaque
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is an opaque Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: An opaque Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x02, bits 23-16 specify the Red component, bits 15-8 specify the Green component and bits 7-0 specify the Blue component. Alpha is 255.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourTransparent
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is a transparent Direct Colours value.

remarks.para:
A transparent Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x03, bits 23-16 specify the Red component, bits 15-8 specify the Green component and bits 7-0 specify the Blue component. Alpha is 128.
Transparent Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourOpaqueDithered
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is an opaque dithered Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: A dithered opaque Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x04, bits 23-20 specify the first Red component, bits 19-16 specify the first Green component, bits 15-12 specify the first Blue component, bits 11-8 specify the second Red component, bits 7-4 specify the second Green component and bits 3-0 specify the second Blue component. The final colour value is a 50-50 blend of the two 12-bit RGB values with an alpha-value of 255.
remarks.note: Dithered Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourTransparentDithered
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is a transparent dithered Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: A dithered transparent Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x05, bits 23-20 specify the Red component, bits 19-16 specify the Green component, bits 15-12 specify the Blue component, and bits 11-0 are unused. The final colour value is the 12-bit RGB value promoted to 24-bit and with an alpha-value of 128.
remarks.note: Dithered Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDColour.DirectColourTransparentDitheredAlt
member.summary: The flag indicating that the colour-value is a transparent dithered Direct Colours value.

remarks.para: A dithered transparent Direct Colours colour-value is a 32-bit unsigned integer in big-endian format. Bits 31-24 have the fixed value 0x06, bits 23-16 are unused, bits 15-12 specify the Red component, bits 11-8 specify the Green component and bits 7-0 specify the Blue component. The final colour value is the 12-bit RGB value promoted to 24-bit and with an alpha-value of 128.
remarks.note: Dithered Direct Colours values are not permitted in official files.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor
member.summary: Represents an editor control for an .

remarks.para: Each concrete subclass of which has caller-settable properties should provide an implementation of IElementEditor that supplies a user-interface to edit the values of those properties. An instance of the implementation should be returned by .

The implementation is free to use whatever controls are appropriate to support the properties of the . Changes made to the values of the controls must not be applied to the until is called. If possible and appropriate, the implementation should support the Analytics system.

member.name: M:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.ApplyChanges
member.summary: Applies the current value(s) in the to its .

member.name: M:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.Reset
member.summary: Resets the to the initial value(s) of its .

member.name: E:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.ValuesChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the 's value(s) change.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.Control
member.summary: Returns the which provides the UI for the .

remarks.para: The control must provide values for and . If the control is not resizable then and must be set to the same value.
The control may manage its own size, and is free to change this at any time. Applications should handle the event and update their layout as required.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.AnalyticsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should perform Analytics.

remarks.para: Default value is false.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.AnalyticsMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode to be used when performing Analytics.

remarks.para: Default value is .

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current value(s) in the can be applied to its .

remarks.para: This must return false when the current value(s) would result in a structural problem if applied, and true otherwise.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.HasChanges
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current value(s) in the differ from those of its .

remarks.para: If the current value(s) in the are different to the current value(s) of its , this must return true. Note that the values of the may change during the lifetime of the , so they must be read each time this property is retrieved.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.CanReset
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current value(s) in the differ from those when it was created.

remarks.para: If the current value(s) in the are different to the initial value(s) of its , this must return true.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.ErrorHighlight
member.summary: Gets or sets the colour that should be used to highlight errors the wants to bring to the user's attention.

remarks.para: If the implements Analytics, this colour may be used to highlight UI elements which are currently in an state. Editors should prefer to use , as this provides a user-friendly description of the problems, but use of this colour may be appropriate where the covers multiple controls, or applies only to part of a multi-value control, and the editor wishes to highlight the affected area.
Default value is .

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.IElementEditor.WarningHighlight
member.summary: Gets or sets the colour that should be used to highlight warnings the wants to bring to the user's attention.

remarks.para: If the implements Analyticsthis colour may be used to highlight UI elements which are currently in an state. Editors should prefer to use , as this provides a user-friendly description of the problems, but use of this colour may be appropriate where the covers multiple controls, or applies only to part of a multi-value control, and the editor wishes to highlight the affected area.
Default value is .

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus
member.summary: Specifies the current status of the file represented by an .

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.Private
member.summary: The file is not in the current Parts Library, nor on the Parts Tracker.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.Unreleased
member.summary: The file is on the Parts Tracker.

remarks.para: Normally one of the more specific values such as or will be returned. This value is returned if the file's current status does not fall into one of the other categories.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.Released
member.summary: The file is in the current Parts Library.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.Held
member.summary: The file is on the Parts Tracker, but has at least one 'hold' vote against it.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.Uncertified
member.summary: The file is on the Parts Tracker, but has not been certified by at least two reviewers.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.Certified
member.summary: The file is on the Parts Tracker, has at least two 'certify' votes but has not yet been admin-certified.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.ReadyForRelease
member.summary: The file is on the Parts Tracker and has been admin-certified.

member.name: F:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.DocumentStatus.Rework
member.summary: The file is in the current Parts Library, but is also on the Parts Tracker for further work.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.MetaCommandPatternAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a regular-expression which can be used to identify a line of LDraw code supported by the class.

remarks.para: This attribute must be specified at least once on the class, and may be specified as many times as required to cover all the options supported by the class. It must be a string suitable for passing to , and may match all or part of a single line of LDraw code. It is recommended that the pattern be as inclusive as possible to reduce the risk of an ambiguous match.
If the class supports more than one meta-command, or if a single pattern would be too complex to write, the attribute may be specified as many times as required to cover all cases.
May only be used on classes of type , and is required to appear at least once.

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDReference
member.summary: Represents an LDraw sub-file reference as defined in the LDraw.org File Format specification. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: Initially, an LDReference just holds the of the sub-file to which it refers. This may eventually be resolved to an actual , either in the same as the LDReference or in a separate file entirely. In the latter case, to speed up loading and to save resources, LDReference maintains a cache of s which have been loaded via this mechanism. The cache itself is private, but events are available to notify interested parties when cache-entries are added and removed.
The cache is thread-safe, and s in it are frozen.
provides an if the DLL is present.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDReference.TargetKey
member.summary: Gets the used to identify .

remarks.para: If has not been resolved, or has resolved to an in the same document as the , this returns null. Otherwise it returns the value used to identify in 's internal cache. This is the same value passed to subscribers to the event.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDReference.TargetStatus
member.summary: Gets the status of .

remarks.para:
The value returned indicates whether is currently resolved, or else the reason why it is not. As resolving may be an expensive operation, checking the value returned is an efficient means of determining whether is currently available. The possible return values are:
No attempt has been made to resolve since the last time was set
The last attempt to resolve could not find a file matching
The last attempt to resolve found a file that would create a circular-dependency if loaded
The last attempt to resolve found a file that could not be loaded because it was not a valid LDraw file
The last attempt to resolve was successful
This status is updated each time performs a resolve. It is reset to when is set or is called.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDReference.Target
member.summary: Gets the referenced by .
member.exception: One of the subtypes if there was a problem with the Target.

remarks.para: On the first access to this property after a change to , the will attempt to resolve its reference to an .
The 's is checked first, followed by if set, then the folder containing the 's underlying file, and finally the members of the .
Note that this can be an expensive operation, so only use this property if you actually need the . Use if you simply want to know whether the target has been resolved.
If cannot be resolved, null is returned.
Raises the event when its value changes.

When setting, if the supplied value includes the ".mpd", ".ldr" or ".dat" extension or the 's\' or '48\' prefix, these will be removed. They are added to automatically based on the of the .

Names should not exceed 21 characters in length for values of other than , and must not exceed 255 characters in length in any event. If is not then Name should follow the restrictions in the File Format Restrictions for the Official Library.
If a fully- or partially-qualified filesystem path is set, it will be trimmed down to the filename component. Strings will have trailing and leading whitespace removed.
Setting this will cause to update.

Only elements may be added to an .

member.name: T:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDPage.NameFormatProblem
member.summary: Specifies the problems found with during analysis.

remarks.para: Other than the restrictions imposed by the filesystem, is free-form. However, for certain s of it should conform to a specific format and should not contain characters disallowed by the File Format Restrictions for the Official Library.

The following formats are recognised by , and will check for them:
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker][shortcut-marker]
nnnnn[suffix]
nnnnn
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker][shortcut-marker]
nnnnn
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker][shortcut-marker]
[prefix]nnnnn[suffix][pattern-marker]subpart-marker
where:
prefix is one of u, x or s
nnnnn is one or more digits
suffix is any letter
pattern-marker is a p followed by two or more letters or digits; the letters i, l, o and p may only be used if the first character after the p is a t, a u or a v
shortcut-marker is a c or a d followed by two or more digits
subpart-marker is an s followed by two or more digits
and [...] denotes that the token is optional. For all other s, is free-form.

member.seealso: LDraw.org Parts Tracker Patterned Part Information
Parts numbering scheme for parts with unknown numbers

remarks.para:
is generally a free-form string, but certain s of should conform to a specific format:
the should start with an underscore ('_') character and end with the colour-value enclosed in square brackets
the should start with an underscore ('_') character and end with the colour-value enclosed in square brackets
the should start with a tilde ('~') character
Single-digit numbers in , unless they are the first character, should be separated from the previous token by two space characters; otherwise tokens in should be separated by a single space character.

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.LDTranslationCatalog.MovedToTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template to use when translating a "~Moved to" .
member.exception: is not .
The supplied value is incorrectly formatted.

remarks.para: If is and the key passed to is in the form "~Moved to {name}", where "{name}" is an arbitrary string, then it is not required that an explicit match exist in the for a translation to be returned; instead, if no explicit match can be found, the translated string can be constructed automatically using the key and the value of this property.

To enable this behaviour, the property must be set to a string which contains the character-sequence {0}. It must contain the sequence exactly once, and may not contain any other instances of the { or } characters. The sequence may appear at any point in the string. If the string is absent or invalid automatic translation will be disabled, and "~Moved to" keys will only be translated if they have an explict match in the .
Default value is null.

remarks.para:
The data loaded from will be sanitised:
trailing empty comments are removed from each
blocks of empty comments are collapsed down to a single empty comment
invalid duplicated lines in the page header are converted into comments
if the or of a page conflicts with the page's , it will be fixed

If is not null then it will be called periodically as the stream is parsed. Two types of callback message are sent:
if progress is -1 then name is the Title of the first in the document, or if the page has no title
if progress is 0..100 then name is the name of the currently being loaded

The parser may need to modify the document during loading, either in order to follow the rules specified by or to correct errors in the document's structure. If this happens, will be set to true before returning. The underlying file referenced by will be unchanged.

The following occurrences will cause a modification:
specifies and an is encountered which refers to a ~Moved to file; the reference's will be changed to the of the new file
specifies and an is encountered which refers to an or ; the reference's will be changed to the of the aliased file
an is encountered whose begins with an x but for which the referenced file has been renamed from xNNNNN to NNNNN, where NNNNN is the 'base' name of the part the file represents; the reference's will be changed to the new name
an is loaded whose Name: and !LDRAW_ORG fields are invalid or inconsistent; the page's will be changed to a correct value, and any s in the document will be updated with this value

member.name: P:Digitalis.LDTools.DOM.Configuration.LDrawBase
member.summary: Gets or sets the path of the LDraw base folder.
member.exception: The ldconfig.ldr file cannot be read.
One of the required folders cannot be found.

remarks.para:
This is the folder where the LDraw parts library is stored, and is required to contain at least the following items:
ldconfig.ldr
\Parts
\Parts\S
\P
\P\48
On loading, the DLL attempts to locate the LDraw base folder by checking the following locations in order:
The value stored in the application's Application Settings file
The user's LDraw.ini file
C:\LDraw
The user's home folder
The user's My Documents folder
The Program Files folder
If any of these is found to contain a valid LDraw library, it will be used.
The value is persisted in the calling application's Application Settings file. Applications are recommended to provide the user with a means to set the value.
Raises the event when its value changes.
